results.title: Ace Ventura: when nature calls
results.creator_credit: James G. Robinson, Morgan Creek and Steve Oedekerk
results.brief_description: Jim Carrey again stars as Ace Ventura, the animal sleuth with the gravity-defying hairstyle in this sequel to ‘Ace Ventura, Pet Detective’ (309280). In the deepest jungles of Africa, two tribes will fight a savage war unless their sacred animal god is found, so they’re sending for the only man who can help, Ace Ventura. Africa will never be the same again as Ace discovers the animal within and answers the call of the wild in this out-there comedy. Cast includes Jim Carrey, Ian McNeice, Simon Callow, Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje and Maynard Eziashi.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James G. Robinson, Morgan Creek and Steve Oedekerk

results.title: Ace Ventura: pet detective
results.creator_credit: James G. Robinson, Morgan Creek and Tom Shadyac
results.brief_description: There’s hope out there for all distraught pet owners concerned about the disappearance of their pets; Ace Ventura, pet detective, whose leading the small but exclusive field. Ace is contacted by the beautiful Melissa (Courteney Cox), to locate Snowflake, dolphin mascot of the Miami Football team and good luck charm. Ace is not only up against a ruthless kidnapper, but scorn and resistance from the police force who have the utmost contempt for his profession. Cast includes Jim Carrey, Sean Young, Courteney Cox, Tone Loc and Dan Marino (Miami Dolphins).

results.title: Accused
results.creator_credit: Criterion Film Productions, Marcel Hellman, Douglas Fairbanks and Thornton Freeland
results.brief_description: A British melodrama set around a Paris dance troupe and the main performers, Tony (Douglas Fairbanks Jr) and Gaby (Dolores Del Rio) Seymour. When dancer Yvette Delange (Florence Desmond) begins to direct her attentions to the somewhat unwilling Tony, a quarrel ensues between Yvette and Gaby. The sudden death by stabbing of Yvette causes suspicion to fall on Gaby and it is only when the trial takes place, the true identity of the murderer is unmasked. Cast also includes Basil Sydney, Googie Withers, Cecil Humphreys.

results.title: Accountancy today!
results.brief_description: A career film. An Accountant needs an inquiring mind and the ability to communicate effectively; he must collect and record facts, analyse them, prepare reports, discuss financial implications, control their results. After a three year full-time course of study at a university or technical college, he can gain employment in a secure, well-paid position which may lead to promotion to top executive positions in commerce, industry, government departments or private practice.

results.title: According to the evidence
results.brief_description: Scenes in a committal hearing and in court with a jury are created and structured to present, for the benefit of law students, the problems, laws and precedents regarding the nature and admissibility of evidence

results.title: According to specification?
results.creator_credit: Denis Ward, Technical and Scientific Films, British Productivity Council and Phil Dennis
results.brief_description: The problem of maintaining a consistent quality standard in manufactured products is discussed by a Production Director and a Sales Director. Conventional methods of inspection between processes and again of the final product prove too costly, and it is decided that quality control should become part of the manufacturing process. The practical, theoretical and statistical aspects of quality control are fully developed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Denis Ward, Technical and Scientific Films, British Productivity Council and Phil Dennis

results.title: According to plan
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Engineering Drawing”.
The aim of this film is to help the beginning student to get started on the right track in their thinking about engineering drawing. It tackles this objective partly through an emotional appeal based on the combined stimulation of emotion, sight and sounds, and partly on the development of the simple theme “modern production requires that many people work together on a single project”. To do this they need a language, a means of communication, so that their work can be co-ordinated. This language is engineering drawing.
